üç£  Basic Sushi Roll (Maki) Recipe

üßÇ  Ingredients

  • 2 cups sushi rice
  • 2 1/2 cups water
  • 1/3 cup rice vinegar
  • 3 tbsp sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • Nori (seaweed sheets)
  • Fillings (choose your favorites):
    • Sliced raw or cooked fish (salmon, tuna, imitation crab)
    • Julienne cucumber
    • Avocado slices
    • Cream cheese, pickled radish, etc.
  • Soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger (for serving)

üçö  Step 1: Prepare the Rice

  • Rinse sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
  • Cook rice with 2 1/2 cups of water (use a rice cooker or stovetop).
  • While rice cooks, mix vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small saucepan over low heat until dissolved. Cool it.
  • Once rice is done, gently fold in the vinegar mixture with a wooden spoon. Let cool to room temperature.

üçô  Step 2: Roll the Sushi

  • Place a bamboo mat on a flat surface and cover it with plastic wrap.
  • Lay one sheet of nori on the mat, shiny side down.
  • Wet your hands and spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch strip bare at the top.
  • Add fillings in a line across the center.
  • Lift the edge of the mat and begin to roll tightly. Wet the edge of the nori to seal.
  • Use a sharp knife to cut into 6‚Äì8 pieces (wet the knife between cuts for clean slices).

üçΩÔ∏è  Step 3: Serve

  • Arrange sushi rolls on a plate.
  • Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.
